meanings.definition: A section of a river or stream that diverges from the main channel and then re-enters it.
meanings.sent1: The explorers paddled through the anabranches of the river, marveling at the different paths the water took.
meanings.sent2: The anabranches of the river provided a habitat for various fish species.
meanings.sent3: The anabranches of the river seemed like secret passages leading to hidden treasures.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts flowed like anabranches, branching off into different directions before coming back together.
meanings.sent5: The anabranches of the river were like nature's maze, offering surprises at every turn.

meanings.sent1: The anabranches of the tree swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: She picked a ripe apple from one of the anabranches of the apple tree.
meanings.sent3: The anabranches of the conversation led to unexpected topics.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were like anabranches, branching out from the main concept.
meanings.sent5: The anabranches of the project brought fresh perspectives to the team.
